newsitem.title: DENMARK: SAS adamant on agents' commissions.
newsitem.headline: SAS adamant on agents' commissions.

text.p: Scandinavian Airlines System (SAS) said on Monday that it had no intention of revoking a 50 percent cut in agents' commissions, despite a protest boycott by Danish business travel specialists.

"We have not considered altering our decision, we only hope that our arguments can bring about a solution," spokesman Jens Peter Skaarup told Reuters ahead of a meeting with agents scheduled for Wednesday.
Danish members of the Guild of European Business Travel Agents said on January 10 that they would book clients with competitors to SAS wherever possible.
Skaarup said that it was too early to say if the boycott was having any effect on the airline's business.
SAS argues that technological advances, such as ticketless travel and annual passes, have greatly reduced the effort required from agents. --Soeren Linding Jakobsen, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969653
